div.h4: Let's Eat! Free Breakfast & Lunch at 22 Bus Stops, East and Field

div.p:

div.h4: Applications for Early Access Gifted Students Postponed

div.p:
Early Access applications are being postponed until such time as we have more information regarding the current health situation.
If you have submitted an online application we have it in our electronic files. If you have your portfolio ready to turn in please hold on to it.
Thank you for your support.
(Original Announcement below...)
Online applications (aplicación en español) for Early Access for Gifted Students to Kindergarten or First grade for the 2020-21 school year are now being accepted. The deadline for applications is April 1st, 2020. No applications will be accepted after that date. Students applying for Kindergarten or First grade who meet the October 1st birthday cutoff need not apply for Early Access.

div.div: Applications for Early Access Gifted Students Postponed

span.strong: Early Access applications are being postponed until such time as we have more information regarding the current health situation.
If you have submitted an online application we have it in our electronic files. If you have your portfolio ready to turn in please hold on to it.

hr.p: Online applications (aplicación en español) for Early Access for Gifted Students to Kindergarten or First grade for the 2020-21 school year are now being accepted. The deadline for applications is April 1st, 2020. No applications will be accepted after that date. Students applying for Kindergarten or First grade who meet the October 1st birthday cutoff need not apply for Early Access.

div.p:
A message from Littleton Public Schools Foundation to the community
We are committed to our community!
The Littleton Public Schools Foundation is deeply committed to supporting students, staff and families within Littleton Public Schools and the health and wellbeing of our community is of utmost importance to us. As our school district, community, state, country and those around the world respond to COVID-19 by making difficult decisions, we too must make difficult decisions.
With the closure of Littleton Public Schools through March 29th and the fact that Governor Polis has called for all community events to be cancelled, we have decided to postpone our annual fundraising event, the Spirit Celebration, which was scheduled for April 18th.
We are dedicated to helping protect our most vulnerable community members and do our part in mitigating the spread of the coronavirus. We know you join us in this effort.
As a nonprofit organization dedicated to supporting LPS students through their educational journey as well as funding important social, emotional, and mental wellness programs to help them navigate life and prepare them for their future, we feel it is critical that we continue our work in partnering with businesses and community members to provide needed funding that helps our youth. We are diligently working with our venue partners at CU South Denver Campus on possible dates to host the event in the coming months.
Thank you for your understanding, patience and partnership. Please take care of yourself and your loved ones during this stressful and unpredictable time.
All LPSF upcoming events are postponed until further notice

strong.em: A message from Littleton Public Schools Foundation to the community

div.p: We are committed to our community!

The Littleton Public Schools Foundation is deeply committed to supporting students, staff and families within Littleton Public Schools and the health and wellbeing of our community is of utmost importance to us. As our school district, community, state, country and those around the world respond to COVID-19 by making difficult decisions, we too must make difficult decisions.

With the closure of Littleton Public Schools through March 29th and the fact that Governor Polis has called for all community events to be cancelled, we have decided to postpone our annual fundraising event, the Spirit Celebration, which was scheduled for April 18th.
We are dedicated to helping protect our most vulnerable community members and do our part in mitigating the spread of the coronavirus. We know you join us in this effort.

As a nonprofit organization dedicated to supporting LPS students through their educational journey as well as funding important social, emotional, and mental wellness programs to help them navigate life and prepare them for their future, we feel it is critical that we continue our work in partnering with businesses and community members to provide needed funding that helps our youth. We are diligently working with our venue partners at CU South Denver Campus on possible dates to host the event in the coming months.
Thank you for your understanding, patience and partnership. Please take care of yourself and your loved ones during this stressful and unpredictable time.

p.em: All LPSF upcoming events are postponed until further notice

search button
Non-Discrimination Notice
Littleton Public Schools does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex (which includes marital status), sexual orientation, religion, national origin, ancestry, creed, age, disability, or need for special education services in its programs or activities.
The following individuals have been designated to handle inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies:
For inquiries related to staff:
Mike Jones, Assistant Superintendent of Human Resources
303-347-3375
5776 S. Crocker St. Littleton, CO 80120
mdjones@lps.k12.co.us
For inquiries related to students:
Melissa Cooper, Director of Special Education and Student Support Services
303-347-3472
5776 S. Crocker St. Littleton, CO 80120
mrcooper@lps.k12.co.us
Questions, complaints, or requests for additional information regarding these laws may be forwarded to the designated compliance officer or directly to the U.S. Department of Education, Office for Civil Rights, Region VIII, Federal Office Building 1244 North Speer Blvd., Suite #310, Denver, CO 80204.
